intro: Enneapogon clelandii, commonly known as Cleland's needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, spikelet-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Enneapogon clelandii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
